alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Coke and southwestern Nolan Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, National Weather Service radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Silver and over the border of Coke and Nolan Counties, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds 35 to 40 mph and half inch to penny size hail, along with frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Champion, Maryneal and Silver. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall will reduce visibility for motorists, and could cause ponding of water on roads.
